content: The tasting menu was an absolute journey through local flavors! Each course showcased Stellenbosch produce beautifully. The wine pairing elevated everything. Chef deserves recognition!
title: Culinary masterpiece
author: Food Blogger

content: Service was friendly but the food took forever. We waited over an hour for our mains. When they finally arrived the steak was overcooked. Kitchen seems overwhelmed.
title: Long waits and overcooked food
author: Hungry Tourist

content: Fantastic spot for wine tasting and lunch! The charcuterie board was generous and well-curated. Estate wines were excellent. Staff guided us through the tasting with expertise.
title: Wine tasting excellence
author: Wine Club Members

content: The outdoor area is beautiful but full of wasps! Our meal was constantly interrupted. Staff seemed unconcerned and offered no solution. Very frustrating experience in summer.
title: Wasp problem ruined lunch
author: Summer Visitor

content: Best malva pudding I've ever had! Warm and sticky with perfect custard. The whole meal was comfort food done right. Grandma would approve. Felt like a warm hug.
title: Comfort food perfection
author: Dessert Lover

content: Dirty tablecloths and spotted glasses. Before food even arrived we knew this wasn't going to be good. The pasta confirmed our fears - bland and cold. Very poor standards.
title: Hygiene and quality issues
author: Standards Matter

content: The springbok loin was cooked to perfection - tender and gamey without being overwhelming. Beautiful presentation on local ceramic plates. A true taste of South Africa!
title: Game meat done right
author: Safari Tourist

content: Mixed feelings about this place. The starter was excellent but the main was disappointing. Service varied from attentive to absent. Inconsistent experience overall.
title: Hit and miss
author: New Year Diner

content: Wonderful winelands wedding venue turned restaurant! The setting is romantic and the food matches the ambiance. Perfect for a special date night. Book the garden terrace!
title: Romantic setting
author: Date Night Couple

content: The noise from the N2 highway ruins the atmosphere. You can't have a peaceful meal with trucks roaring past. Food was okay but the location choice is questionable.
title: Too noisy from traffic
author: Peace Seeker

content: Christmas lunch was excellent! The whole family was impressed. Turkey was moist, all the trimmings were perfect, and the service was cheerful despite being busy. Booked again for next year!
title: Perfect Christmas feast
author: Family of Eight

content: Ordered a simple salad and it took 40 minutes. When I asked about it the waiter seemed confused about where it was. Eventually came out wilted. Not impressed with efficiency.
title: Slow and inefficient
author: Lunch Break Lost

content: The craft beer selection is surprisingly good for a wine region! Local breweries featured alongside estate wines. The beer and cheese pairing was unique and tasty.
title: Great craft beer selection
author: Beer Fan in Wine Country

content: Rude host at the door made us feel unwelcome. Almost left but stayed for the view. Food was average but the initial bad impression lingered. Hospitality training needed!
title: Unwelcoming reception
author: First Impressions Matter

content: Delightful afternoon tea experience! Scones were warm and fluffy, clotted cream was generous, and the sandwiches were fresh. Very English but in a beautiful African setting.
title: Lovely afternoon tea
author: Tea Time Tradition
